content.title: Deep Femoral (Profunda Femoris) Artery Anatomy
content.description: Critical collateral vessel providing blood supply to thigh muscles and crucial for limb viability when SFA is occluded.
content.origin: Lateral aspect of CFA, 3-5cm below inguinal ligament
content.course: Runs posterolaterally, deep to adductor longus
content.termination: Fourth perforating artery (at lower third of thigh)

branches.medial_circumflex_femoral: Supplies femoral head (critical in hip surgery)
perforating_arteries: Supply posterior thigh and connect to popliteal genicular

collateral_importance.with_SFA_occlusion: Perforators reconstitute popliteal via genicular network
collateral_importance.preservation: Essential in all femoral surgery - 'lifeblood of the leg'
collateral_importance.profundaplasty: Enlargement of profunda origin when diseased

surgical_significance.inflow_target: Target for aortofemoral or axillofemoral bypass
surgical_significance.outflow_target: Can serve as outflow if distal vessels inadequate

content.statement: Deep Femoral (Profunda Femoris) Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Lower-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Deep Femoral (Profunda Femoris) Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Deep Femoral (Profunda Femoris) Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Deep Femoral (Profunda Femoris) Artery Anatomy.
